channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Cocoa Farmers Uproot Their Plants Despite Record Prices
item.description: Bad weather, failed government policies and a fast-spreading virus are reducing output from the world’s top cocoa-growing countries.

item.title: Why Nvidia Needs to Appeal to a Bigger Crowd
item.description: Investors are hyper-focused on data centers despite big new efforts in gaming, self-driving cars and robotics.

item.title: The 'Hidden Force' That Can Bring Mortgage Rates Down
item.description: How home buyers could get a little break even if yields stay high.

item.title: ‘I will gain no equity’: My boyfriend is buying a townhouse. How much should I pay him in rent?
item.description: “My partner earns about $60,000 a year. I earn about 25% more than he does.’

item.title: Generation Beta is here — and you won’t believe how much today’s newborns will need to retire
item.description: Babies born in 2025 could face a major shortfall in savings in 75 years if things don’t change. Here’s what families can do now to prepare.

item.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq Futures Edge Higher
item.description: U.S. stock futures rose modestly and European markets made gains.

item.title: The market’s wobbling. Here are BlackRock’s shields for the biggest risks.
item.description: Here are the hedges the $11 trillion asset manager recommends for the concerns weighing on investor minds.

item.title: Sterling Dented by U.K. Growth Concerns
item.description: Sterling was weaker, and is among the worst performing G-10 currencies in the past week due to economic outlook concerns, Ebury said, with reports ret...

item.title: Take these steps to set financial goals for your family in 2025 — and reach them
item.description: How you and your partner can make saving easier, spending harder, and teamwork second nature.

item.title: ‘I’ve always been very good with money’: Should I put my wife on the title of my home, investment property and my late father’s house?
item.description: “If I die and she sells the properties, would she have to pay a lot of capital-gains taxes, especially on the houses we don’t live in?”
